body.p:
To his Excellency Jas F Robinson Thos E Bramlette
Governor of State of Kentucky
Frankfort Ky

Your petitioner -- L R Cheek -- would respectfully represent that he is a citizen of Smithland in Livingston County Kentucky. That in the year of 1862, kept a grocery under License for sale to citizens of sd county. That he has in everything endeavored to respect & obey all laws that he is and has ever been a Union loyal man, ever opposed to the rebellion and has never aided or abetted or countenanced the opposers of the Govr.

States that Hill is and was in 1862 the overseer of D B Sanders in Livingston County having charge & control of his negroes. States that in the month of February 1863 sd Hill came into your petitioner's grocery with "Henry" one of D B Sanders negroes under his control as overseer & requested your petitioner to let him have a pint of liquor. Your petitioner was not present being sick but his son sold the liquor. Your petitioner being ignorant of the statute law let the boy have the liquor on verbal order -- overseer Hill being present -- not knowing it required a written order when master or person controlling negro was present -- states that afterwards to wit on day of 1863 Grand jury of sd county found a Bill against your petitioner for selling to slave without written order & on sd Bill jury at our last court August 1863
a jury fined your petitioner the sum of Fifty-Dolls ($50)

Your petitioner would most humbly beg under the circumstances that your Honor Remit sd Fine -- Believing that the spirit of the law never intended or contemplated such cases as this -- Hill the overseer was present when the liquor was bot and came in with the negro Henry & requested that your petitioner let him have it. Both Hill (overseer) & your petitioners were ignorant of it requiring a written order when Master was present.

Your petitioner is a very poor man -- and depends wholly on his exertions as laborer to make a living -- is now working at the Tin business in Smithland -- Trusting the clemency of Your Excellency in this matter, is
We know L R Cheek well and believe that he is an honest man & would not misrepresent facts and beg that his fine be remitted

Jas E Hamilton
